abstract: A judge approved an unusual resolution to the federal case against the mortgage giant, with the S.E.C. and Freddie Mac agreeing “no party is the prevailing party.”
snippet: A judge approved an unusual resolution to the federal case against the mortgage giant, with the S.E.C. and Freddie Mac agreeing “no party is the prevailing party.”
lead_paragraph: At a news conference in Washington three years ago, federal regulators trumpeted their case against former executives at the mortgage giant Freddie Mac, proclaiming that “all individuals, regardless of their rank or position, will be held accountable for perpetuating half-truths or misrepresentations.”

headline.main: Ex-Freddie Mac Leaders Reach Deal With S.E.C.
headline.print_headline: Ex-Freddie Mac Leaders Reach Deal With S.E.C.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corp (Freddie Mac)

byline.original: By Ben Protess and Peter Eavis
